intro: Peixotoa jussieuana var. velutina, commonly known as the velvet peixotoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in the humid, shaded conditions of the forest floor. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
